content.title: Compression Therapy
content.definition: Graduated compression (30-40mmHg) is cornerstone of venous disease treatment. Improves ulcer healing, reduces edema.
content.statement: Compression Therapy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous-Disease that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Compression Therapy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Compression Therapy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Compression Therapy.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
